page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO BLOCK
page.content: This block is situated in the Lorne area of Argyll and Bute, which is a division of Stathclyde Region. With the exception of the south eastern corner of the block, the land lies on the northern bank of Loch Awe, the longest fresh water loch in Scotland. The landscape is dominated by Ben Cruachan, the mountain at the top of the loch. It is a sparsely populated area. Agriculture, forestry, and hydro- electricity are the main uses of land and water. Many people living in the block are employed in these industries but others choose to live in the area because of the beauty and peace and commute to Oban,19 miles to the west or even further afield for employment. Tourism is the only other major means of employment but is only seasonal.
